references.paper_title: Elements of Causal Inference: Foundations and Learning Algorithms
references.reason: This book provides a foundational overview of causal inference, forming the basis of many concepts discussed in the target paper.
This highly influential book established the foundational framework for causal inference, which underpins much of the theoretical discussion in the paper.

references.paper_title: Nonlinear causal discovery with additive noise models
references.reason: This paper significantly contributes to causal discovery theory, particularly regarding the identifiability of nonlinear causal models, a key aspect addressed in the paper.

references.paper_title: On the identifiability of the post-nonlinear causal model
references.reason: This work delves into the identifiability of post-nonlinear causal models, directly relevant to the analysis and theoretical claims made in the paper.

references.paper_title: A linear non-gaussian acyclic model for causal discovery
references.reason: This paper introduces the linear non-Gaussian acyclic model (LiNGAM), a crucial model class used for comparison and analysis in the target paper.
